Data AnalystAbout us/team scope:We are the End-to-End Supply Chain team of Walmart USA based in Costa Rica. We design advanced analytical solutions to resolve supply chain strategic problems. We are responsible for the establishment of the data foundation and governance of the supply chain data, providing stewardship, ensuring quality & resolving data issues to offer the single version of truth for the end-to-end supply chain.Entry Requirements ‚Äì Minimum Qualifications:¬∑ Bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer science, engineering, or a data related field.¬∑ 3+ years of experience in data analyst or business intelligence related position.¬∑ High intermediate / Advanced English level (B2+ - C1). Able to communicate in English (written and spoken) with native speakers.¬∑ Proven SQL experience and presenting results to different stakeholders.¬∑ Good interpersonal relationships and presentation skills.¬∑ Demonstrated teamwork and customer centered abilities. Desired skills:¬∑ Database management using tools like Big Query, Presto, Hadoop, MSSQL Server, Oracle.¬∑ Cloud Technologies Knowledge.¬∑ Advance level proficiency in Structured Query Language (SQL).¬∑ Data Visualization tools such as: Tableau, Power BI and/or Looker.¬∑ Availability to travel to Home Office (USA) if required.Job description (Individual Contributor role):We are searching for a Data Analyst responsible of enable advance analytics solutions aligned with data management and business requirements using cloud technologies such as Google Cloud and Azure.We are searching for a Data Analyst responsible for: ¬∑ Translates business logic from multiple data sources like Excel, Oracle, SQL Server to complex SQL queries to calculate KPIs.¬∑ Perform data analysis to solve complex problems and identify value generating trends and insights from multiple data sources.¬∑ Create ad-hoc reports and database queries to support customer data analytics objectives, including identifying key insights, trends, and focal points within the data.Performs initial data quality checks on extracted data and end to end data validation to maintain accuracy of the KPIs.¬∑ Supports the understanding of the priority order of requirements and service level agreements. Data Engineer Level 2-4Entravision is a leading global advertising, media, and ad-tech solutions company connecting brands to consumers by representing top platforms and publishers. Our global commercial footprint is anchored by strategic regional operations in the US, Latin America, Europe, and Asia. This means 5 continents and 30+ countries, and on path to becoming a multinational tech and marketing powerhouse.These branches forge strong client relationships, robust sales operations, and a common globalized corporate culture. Headquartered in Santa Monica, California, USA. shares of Entravision Class A Common Stock trade on The New York Stock Exchange under the ticker symbol: EVC.We are seeking a Data Engineer to join our Global BA and Platforms team. to design, build, manage, and improve our data infrastructure to support robust analytical operations. S/he will assist in the expansion and maintenance of a data warehouse by the construction of views and tables, replace Alteryx workflows with SQL views to help automate manual reporting, support the BI Team with SQL expertise, and architect and implement solutions to meet Entravision's growing internal demand for accurate, accessible data. We are looking for an experienced SQL query-builder who is interested in honing their craft and expanding their role in an exciting, influential, and growing department. While we only have one opening, we will accept candidates for level 2, 3, or 4. The final candidate will work from Montevideo office reporting to the Manager of Enterprise Data Solution based in our US corporate office.Responsibilities IncludeDevelop database tables, views, and stored procedures.Create, monitor, and maintain ETL processes.Document the database and ETL systems including any changes or improvements to the database are implemented.Ensure data quality and integrity in databases.Monitor and report on costs for Database and ETL services.In collaboration with BI Manager, provide guidance, solution design, detailed requirements, and governance for data needs such as acquisition, query, update, transfer, store, archive, etc.Assist with schema design, code review, and SQL query tuning.Work with analysts to secure easy access to company data.Help prioritize, ensure execution, and communicate timelines for existing BI roadmap, new BI requests, and BI platform or underlying data issues.Proactively and regularly make recommendations for system improvementsStay up to date on best practices in Business Intelligence and Data Warehousing.Participate in special projects and perform other duties and assignments as needed. DescriptionAt Neostella, we take a customer-centric approach and use cutting-edge technologies to deliver solutions to meet the unique needs of our clients‚Äô business. We show them how hyperautomation can free up time to focus on higher impact work and take their business to the next level. In order to continue our growth, we are seeking a Data Engineer! By joining our team, you‚Äôll work in a fast-paced, rapidly growing, startup environment. We are looking for a Data Engineer experienced SQL and Python Engineer with expertise in data warehouse and data migrations. This The ideal candidate will have experience with various ETL (extract, transform, load) tools and has experience in developing ETL processes to ensure data quality, accuracy, and consistency. They also have experience in working with large data sets, as well as optimizing SQL queries and improving database performance.Key Responsibilities:Develop and maintain complex SQL scripts and queries to extract, transform, and load data into a data warehouse. Design, implement and optimize data models and database schema for efficient data storage and retrieval. Perform data migrations and integrations between different data sources and systems using Python programming language. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into technical specifications. Analyze, troubleshoot and resolve issues related to data quality, integrity and performance. Develop and maintain documentation of data architecture, data flows, and data lineage. Ensure compliance with data governance policies, standards, and best practices. Develop and maintain data models to support the organization's data needs. Requirements1+ years of experience in SQL development and data modeling for data warehousing. Strong proficiency in Python programming. Experience with ETL tools. Knowledge of cloud-based data storage solutions such as AWS S3, Azure Blob Storage, or Google Cloud Storage. Familiarity with Agile software development methodologies. Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work independently as well as in a team environment. Strong communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders. Desire experience with Ruby or Workato. Fluency in written and spoken English is required. BenefitsYou will have Undefined Contract, a fast and deep growing career path, pre-paid health insurance coverage with Sura for you and one additional member of your family, flex time, flexibility to work from home or in the office, yearly ophthalmological health bonus, and the opportunity to improve your English skills by working side-by-side with international teams and projects, apart from fully personalized English classes, and more!All resumes and application answers must be in English

We are responsible for the establishment of the data foundation and governance of the supply chain data, providing stewardship, ensuring quality & resolving data issues to offer the single version of truth for the end-to-end supply chain.Entry Requirements ‚Äì Minimum Qualifications:¬∑ Bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer science, engineering, or a data related field.¬∑ 3+ years of experience in data analyst or business intelligence related position.¬∑ High intermediate / Advanced English level (B2+ - C1). Able to communicate in English (written and spoken) with native speakers.¬∑ Proven SQL experience and presenting results to different stakeholders.¬∑ Good interpersonal relationships and presentation skills.¬∑ Demonstrated teamwork and customer centered abilities. Desired skills:¬∑ Database management using tools like Big Query, Presto, Hadoop, MSSQL Server, Oracle.¬∑ Cloud Technologies Knowledge.¬∑ Advance level proficiency in Structured Query Language (SQL).¬∑ Data Visualization tools such as: Tableau, Power BI and/or Looker.¬∑ Availability to travel to Home Office (USA) if required.Job description (Individual Contributor role):We are searching for a Data Analyst responsible of enable advance analytics solutions aligned with data management and business requirements using cloud technologies such as Google Cloud and Azure.We are searching for a Data Analyst responsible for: ¬∑ Translates business logic from multiple data sources like Excel, Oracle, SQL Server to complex SQL queries to calculate KPIs.¬∑ Perform data analysis to solve complex problems and identify value generating trends and insights from multiple data sources.¬∑ Create ad-hoc reports and database queries to support customer data analytics objectives, including identifying key insights, trends, and focal points within the data.Performs initial data quality checks on extracted data and end to end data validation to maintain accuracy of the KPIs.¬∑ Supports the understanding of the priority order of requirements and service level agreements. Helps identify the most suitable source for data that is fit for purpose. ¬∑ Identifies what methods (for example, analytics, big data analytics, automation) would provide a solution for the problem. Shares use cases and gives examples to demonstrate how the method would solve the business problem.¬∑ Engage with customers from different areas to understand their business needs from a data standpoint and translate those into actions plans to fulfill those needs. ¬∑ Communicate effectively and develop relationship with technical experts and business leaders in a dynamic, multicultural, and international environment.

It is an exciting time at IFF as we continue to grow our Digital Operations team!Create a change that everyone wants a taste of. Make a difference at IFF. If you haven‚Äôt heard of IFF before (treasures are truly hard to find), it‚Äôs time to get excited. Welcome to the world‚Äôs best-kept secret and scent. At IFF, we apply science and creativity for a better world, push past traditional boundaries and towards a more sustainable future. We are on a mission to co-create sensorial experiences that delight and go beyond the expectations of consumers everywhere.While have grown over the years, we remain agile in our approach and put our customers‚Äô needs at the forefront of our thinking. We are an international collective of thinkers represented at over 110 manufacturing sites and 100 R&D centers globally. Now is your chance to join us and help us to find digital solutions to make our work even better, more influential, and more sustainable.To achieve this ambitious goal, we need you. How You‚Äôll Leave Your Mark as a Data Engineer, you will be responsible for expanding and optimizing our data and data pipeline architecture, as well as optimizing data flow and collection for cross-functional teams.You will support our software developers, database architects, data analysts, and data scientists on data initiatives and will ensure optimal data delivery architecture is consistent throughout ongoing projects.You will‚Ä¶Identify data solutions that have business applications and translate them into design specifications and codeWrite ETL processes, design database systems, and develop tools for real-time and offline analytic processingTroubleshoot software and processes for data consistency and integrity. Integrate large scale data from a variety of sources for business partners to generate insight and make decisionsDesign and conduct training sessions on tools, data sources, and architecture. Provide job aids and mentoring to team members and business usersKeep up to speed with the latest industry and technology developments, and apply them to solve analytics challenges focused on business performanceYou have‚Ä¶A degree in Computer Science or relatedAt least 5 years of software development or data engineering experienceProficiency with languages/tools Python, SQL, GitExperience with On Premise and Cloud based infrastructuresStrongly preferred:DevOps or MLOps experienceDocker, KubernetesExperience deploying ML and non-ML data products with AWSWhy working at IFF will be the cherry on the cake of your career. We cherish your individuality. Our diversity, equity, and inclusion programs prove that different backgrounds and attitudes are key factors to our success. We know your worth. We guarantee an attractive and competitive salary as a means of showing you our appreciation. We value your personal work style. We trust you. Whether you work remotely or on site, we want you to do what‚Äôs best for you and shape your work to fit your life. We trust your creativity. We support out-of-the-box thinking without hierarchies. In our teams, it‚Äôs the best idea that wins, not the one from the highest position. We want you to thrive. Our IFF university will meet all your personal development and growth needs because now is only the beginning. We care about you. Our health insurance and pension plans ensure that your well-being is secure ‚Äì professionally and privately.

Data Engineer Level 2-4Entravision is a leading global advertising, media, and ad-tech solutions company connecting brands to consumers by representing top platforms and publishers. Our global commercial footprint is anchored by strategic regional operations in the US, Latin America, Europe, and Asia. This means 5 continents and 30+ countries, and on path to becoming a multinational tech and marketing powerhouse.These branches forge strong client relationships, robust sales operations, and a common globalized corporate culture. Headquartered in Santa Monica, California, USA. shares of Entravision Class A Common Stock trade on The New York Stock Exchange under the ticker symbol: EVC.We are seeking a Data Engineer to join our Global BA and Platforms team. to design, build, manage, and improve our data infrastructure to support robust analytical operations. S/he will assist in the expansion and maintenance of a data warehouse by the construction of views and tables, replace Alteryx workflows with SQL views to help automate manual reporting, support the BI Team with SQL expertise, and architect and implement solutions to meet Entravision's growing internal demand for accurate, accessible data. We are looking for an experienced SQL query-builder who is interested in honing their craft and expanding their role in an exciting, influential, and growing department. While we only have one opening, we will accept candidates for level 2, 3, or 4. The final candidate will work from Montevideo office reporting to the Manager of Enterprise Data Solution based in our US corporate office.Responsibilities IncludeDevelop database tables, views, and stored procedures.Create, monitor, and maintain ETL processes.Document the database and ETL systems including any changes or improvements to the database are implemented.Ensure data quality and integrity in databases.Monitor and report on costs for Database and ETL services.In collaboration with BI Manager, provide guidance, solution design, detailed requirements, and governance for data needs such as acquisition, query, update, transfer, store, archive, etc.Assist with schema design, code review, and SQL query tuning.Work with analysts to secure easy access to company data.Help prioritize, ensure execution, and communicate timelines for existing BI roadmap, new BI requests, and BI platform or underlying data issues.Proactively and regularly make recommendations for system improvementsStay up to date on best practices in Business Intelligence and Data Warehousing.Participate in special projects and perform other duties and assignments as needed. Soft SkillsA proactive team-player with the ability to multitask, think creatively, and learn quickly in a fast-paced, results-driven environment.A resourceful, motivated self-starter with the ability to complete work independently and on time.Strong verbal and written communications skills in English.The willingness to both offer, and receive, constructive feedback.Technical RequirementsLevel I:1 - 2 years of SQL Scripting experienceExperience in OLAP databases such as Snowflake or RedshiftExperience with a BI tool (Tableau, PowerBI, Microstrategy)Experience with an ETL tool (Fivetran, Stitch, Rivery, Airbyte)Cloud Storage (S3, Blob)Batch and Cron JobsLevel II (level I Plus)3+ years of SQL Scripting experienceExperience making API calls in Python, Curl, PostmanWrite testable production code in scripting language (Python, Scala, Java)Experience using JIRA Software and ConfluenceData serialization formats (CSV, JSON, XML, Parquet, Avro, YAML)Level III (level II Plus)Experience in making API calls in Python, Curl, PostmanExposure to transformation tool like DBTWrite testable production code in scripting language (Python, Scala, Java)Orchestrate cloud infrastructure using IaC tools (Terraform, AWS CloudFormation, Azure Resource Manager)Data serialization formats (CSV, JSON, XML, Parquet, Avro, YAML)Level IV (level III Plus)Experience with DevOps: CI/CD, deployment, orchestration, and control systems such as GitUnderstanding of NoSQL databasesData architecture and modeling (Kimball, Inmon, Data Vault)Experience with orchestrator tools such as Airflow or LuigiFamiliar with data governance strategies and tools Experience with PySparkKnowledge of data Streaming best practices and tools (Kafka, Kinesis) Other DutiesPlease note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.Entravision Communications Corporation participates in the E-Verify system operated by the US Department of Homeland Security and the Social Security Administration and will use E-Verify to confirm work eligibility for all new hire employees.Entravision Communications is an Equal Opportunity Employer.We encourage women and minorities to apply.

Data AnalystAbout us/team scope:We are the End-to-End Supply Chain team of Walmart USA based in Costa Rica. We design advanced analytical solutions to resolve supply chain strategic problems. We are responsible for the establishment of the data foundation and governance of the supply chain data, providing stewardship, ensuring quality & resolving data issues to offer the single version of truth for the end-to-end supply chain.Entry Requirements ‚Äì Minimum Qualifications:¬∑ Bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer science, engineering, or a data related field.¬∑ 3+ years of experience in data analyst or business intelligence related position.¬∑ High intermediate / Advanced English level (B2+ - C1). Able to communicate in English (written and spoken) with native speakers.¬∑ Proven SQL experience and presenting results to different stakeholders.¬∑ Good interpersonal relationships and presentation skills.¬∑ Demonstrated teamwork and customer centered abilities. Desired skills:¬∑ Database management using tools like Big Query, Presto, Hadoop, MSSQL Server, Oracle.¬∑ Cloud Technologies Knowledge.¬∑ Advance level proficiency in Structured Query Language (SQL).¬∑ Data Visualization tools such as: Tableau, Power BI and/or Looker.¬∑ Availability to travel to Home Office (USA) if required.Job description (Individual Contributor role):We are searching for a Data Analyst responsible of enable advance analytics solutions aligned with data management and business requirements using cloud technologies such as Google Cloud and Azure.We are searching for a Data Analyst responsible for: ¬∑ Translates business logic from multiple data sources like Excel, Oracle, SQL Server to complex SQL queries to calculate KPIs.¬∑ Perform data analysis to solve complex problems and identify value generating trends and insights from multiple data sources.¬∑ Create ad-hoc reports and database queries to support customer data analytics objectives, including identifying key insights, trends, and focal points within the data.Performs initial data quality checks on extracted data and end to end data validation to maintain accuracy of the KPIs.¬∑ Supports the understanding of the priority order of requirements and service level agreements. Helps identify the most suitable source for data that is fit for purpose. ¬∑ Identifies what methods (for example, analytics, big data analytics, automation) would provide a solution for the problem. Shares use cases and gives examples to demonstrate how the method would solve the business problem.¬∑ Engage with customers from different areas to understand their business needs from a data standpoint and translate those into actions plans to fulfill those needs. ¬∑ Communicate effectively and develop relationship with technical experts and business leaders in a dynamic, multicultural, and international environment.

It is an exciting time at IFF as we continue to grow our Digital Operations team!Create a change that everyone wants a taste of. Make a difference at IFF. If you haven‚Äôt heard of IFF before (treasures are truly hard to find), it‚Äôs time to get excited. Welcome to the world‚Äôs best-kept secret and scent. At IFF, we apply science and creativity for a better world, push past traditional boundaries and towards a more sustainable future. We are on a mission to co-create sensorial experiences that delight and go beyond the expectations of consumers everywhere.While have grown over the years, we remain agile in our approach and put our customers‚Äô needs at the forefront of our thinking. We are an international collective of thinkers represented at over 110 manufacturing sites and 100 R&D centers globally. Now is your chance to join us and help us to find digital solutions to make our work even better, more influential, and more sustainable.To achieve this ambitious goal, we need you. How You‚Äôll Leave Your Mark as a Data Engineer, you will be responsible for expanding and optimizing our data and data pipeline architecture, as well as optimizing data flow and collection for cross-functional teams.You will support our software developers, database architects, data analysts, and data scientists on data initiatives and will ensure optimal data delivery architecture is consistent throughout ongoing projects.You will‚Ä¶Identify data solutions that have business applications and translate them into design specifications and codeWrite ETL processes, design database systems, and develop tools for real-time and offline analytic processingTroubleshoot software and processes for data consistency and integrity. Integrate large scale data from a variety of sources for business partners to generate insight and make decisionsDesign and conduct training sessions on tools, data sources, and architecture. Provide job aids and mentoring to team members and business usersKeep up to speed with the latest industry and technology developments, and apply them to solve analytics challenges focused on business performanceYou have‚Ä¶A degree in Computer Science or relatedAt least 5 years of software development or data engineering experienceProficiency with languages/tools Python, SQL, GitExperience with On Premise and Cloud based infrastructuresStrongly preferred:DevOps or MLOps experienceDocker, KubernetesExperience deploying ML and non-ML data products with AWSWhy working at IFF will be the cherry on the cake of your career. We cherish your individuality. Our diversity, equity, and inclusion programs prove that different backgrounds and attitudes are key factors to our success. We know your worth. We guarantee an attractive and competitive salary as a means of showing you our appreciation. We value your personal work style. We trust you. Whether you work remotely or on site, we want you to do what‚Äôs best for you and shape your work to fit your life. We trust your creativity. We support out-of-the-box thinking without hierarchies. In our teams, it‚Äôs the best idea that wins, not the one from the highest position. We want you to thrive. Our IFF university will meet all your personal development and growth needs because now is only the beginning. We care about you. Our health insurance and pension plans ensure that your well-being is secure ‚Äì professionally and privately.

Data Engineer Level 2-4Entravision is a leading global advertising, media, and ad-tech solutions company connecting brands to consumers by representing top platforms and publishers. Our global commercial footprint is anchored by strategic regional operations in the US, Latin America, Europe, and Asia. This means 5 continents and 30+ countries, and on path to becoming a multinational tech and marketing powerhouse.These branches forge strong client relationships, robust sales operations, and a common globalized corporate culture. Headquartered in Santa Monica, California, USA. shares of Entravision Class A Common Stock trade on The New York Stock Exchange under the ticker symbol: EVC.We are seeking a Data Engineer to join our Global BA and Platforms team. to design, build, manage, and improve our data infrastructure to support robust analytical operations. S/he will assist in the expansion and maintenance of a data warehouse by the construction of views and tables, replace Alteryx workflows with SQL views to help automate manual reporting, support the BI Team with SQL expertise, and architect and implement solutions to meet Entravision's growing internal demand for accurate, accessible data. We are looking for an experienced SQL query-builder who is interested in honing their craft and expanding their role in an exciting, influential, and growing department. While we only have one opening, we will accept candidates for level 2, 3, or 4. The final candidate will work from Montevideo office reporting to the Manager of Enterprise Data Solution based in our US corporate office.Responsibilities IncludeDevelop database tables, views, and stored procedures.Create, monitor, and maintain ETL processes.Document the database and ETL systems including any changes or improvements to the database are implemented.Ensure data quality and integrity in databases.Monitor and report on costs for Database and ETL services.In collaboration with BI Manager, provide guidance, solution design, detailed requirements, and governance for data needs such as acquisition, query, update, transfer, store, archive, etc.Assist with schema design, code review, and SQL query tuning.Work with analysts to secure easy access to company data.Help prioritize, ensure execution, and communicate timelines for existing BI roadmap, new BI requests, and BI platform or underlying data issues.Proactively and regularly make recommendations for system improvementsStay up to date on best practices in Business Intelligence and Data Warehousing.Participate in special projects and perform other duties and assignments as needed. Soft SkillsA proactive team-player with the ability to multitask, think creatively, and learn quickly in a fast-paced, results-driven environment.A resourceful, motivated self-starter with the ability to complete work independently and on time.Strong verbal and written communications skills in English.The willingness to both offer, and receive, constructive feedback.Technical RequirementsLevel I:1 - 2 years of SQL Scripting experienceExperience in OLAP databases such as Snowflake or RedshiftExperience with a BI tool (Tableau, PowerBI, Microstrategy)Experience with an ETL tool (Fivetran, Stitch, Rivery, Airbyte)Cloud Storage (S3, Blob)Batch and Cron JobsLevel II (level I Plus)3+ years of SQL Scripting experienceExperience making API calls in Python, Curl, PostmanWrite testable production code in scripting language (Python, Scala, Java)Experience using JIRA Software and ConfluenceData serialization formats (CSV, JSON, XML, Parquet, Avro, YAML)Level III (level II Plus)Experience in making API calls in Python, Curl, PostmanExposure to transformation tool like DBTWrite testable production code in scripting language (Python, Scala, Java)Orchestrate cloud infrastructure using IaC tools (Terraform, AWS CloudFormation, Azure Resource Manager)Data serialization formats (CSV, JSON, XML, Parquet, Avro, YAML)Level IV (level III Plus)Experience with DevOps: CI/CD, deployment, orchestration, and control systems such as GitUnderstanding of NoSQL databasesData architecture and modeling (Kimball, Inmon, Data Vault)Experience with orchestrator tools such as Airflow or LuigiFamiliar with data governance strategies and tools Experience with PySparkKnowledge of data Streaming best practices and tools (Kafka, Kinesis) Other DutiesPlease note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.Entravision Communications Corporation participates in the E-Verify system operated by the US Department of Homeland Security and the Social Security Administration and will use E-Verify to confirm work eligibility for all new hire employees.Entravision Communications is an Equal Opportunity Employer.We encourage women and minorities to apply.

Data AnalystAbout us/team scope:We are the End-to-End Supply Chain team of Walmart USA based in Costa Rica. We design advanced analytical solutions to resolve supply chain strategic problems. We are responsible for the establishment of the data foundation and governance of the supply chain data, providing stewardship, ensuring quality & resolving data issues to offer the single version of truth for the end-to-end supply chain.Entry Requirements ‚Äì Minimum Qualifications:¬∑ Bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer science, engineering, or a data related field.¬∑ 3+ years of experience in data analyst or business intelligence related position.¬∑ High intermediate / Advanced English level (B2+ - C1). Able to communicate in English (written and spoken) with native speakers.¬∑ Proven SQL experience and presenting results to different stakeholders.¬∑ Good interpersonal relationships and presentation skills.¬∑ Demonstrated teamwork and customer centered abilities. Desired skills:¬∑ Database management using tools like Big Query, Presto, Hadoop, MSSQL Server, Oracle.¬∑ Cloud Technologies Knowledge.¬∑ Advance level proficiency in Structured Query Language (SQL).¬∑ Data Visualization tools such as: Tableau, Power BI and/or Looker.¬∑ Availability to travel to Home Office (USA) if required.Job description (Individual Contributor role):We are searching for a Data Analyst responsible of enable advance analytics solutions aligned with data management and business requirements using cloud technologies such as Google Cloud and Azure.We are searching for a Data Analyst responsible for: ¬∑ Translates business logic from multiple data sources like Excel, Oracle, SQL Server to complex SQL queries to calculate KPIs.¬∑ Perform data analysis to solve complex problems and identify value generating trends and insights from multiple data sources.¬∑ Create ad-hoc reports and database queries to support customer data analytics objectives, including identifying key insights, trends, and focal points within the data.Performs initial data quality checks on extracted data and end to end data validation to maintain accuracy of the KPIs.¬∑ Supports the understanding of the priority order of requirements and service level agreements. Helps identify the most suitable source for data that is fit for purpose. ¬∑ Identifies what methods (for example, analytics, big data analytics, automation) would provide a solution for the problem. Shares use cases and gives examples to demonstrate how the method would solve the business problem.¬∑ Engage with customers from different areas to understand their business needs from a data standpoint and translate those into actions plans to fulfill those needs. ¬∑ Communicate effectively and develop relationship with technical experts and business leaders in a dynamic, multicultural, and international environment.

DescriptionAt Neostella, we take a customer-centric approach and use cutting-edge technologies to deliver solutions to meet the unique needs of our clients‚Äô business. We show them how hyperautomation can free up time to focus on higher impact work and take their business to the next level. In order to continue our growth, we are seeking a Data Engineer! By joining our team, you‚Äôll work in a fast-paced, rapidly growing, startup environment. We are looking for a Data Engineer experienced SQL and Python Engineer with expertise in data warehouse and data migrations. This The ideal candidate will have experience with various ETL (extract, transform, load) tools and has experience in developing ETL processes to ensure data quality, accuracy, and consistency. They also have experience in working with large data sets, as well as optimizing SQL queries and improving database performance.Key Responsibilities:Develop and maintain complex SQL scripts and queries to extract, transform, and load data into a data warehouse. Design, implement and optimize data models and database schema for efficient data storage and retrieval. Perform data migrations and integrations between different data sources and systems using Python programming language. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into technical specifications. Analyze, troubleshoot and resolve issues related to data quality, integrity and performance. Develop and maintain documentation of data architecture, data flows, and data lineage. Ensure compliance with data governance policies, standards, and best practices. Develop and maintain data models to support the organization's data needs. Requirements1+ years of experience in SQL development and data modeling for data warehousing. Strong proficiency in Python programming. Experience with ETL tools. Knowledge of cloud-based data storage solutions such as AWS S3, Azure Blob Storage, or Google Cloud Storage. Familiarity with Agile software development methodologies. Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work independently as well as in a team environment. Strong communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders. Desire experience with Ruby or Workato. Fluency in written and spoken English is required. BenefitsYou will have Undefined Contract, a fast and deep growing career path, pre-paid health insurance coverage with Sura for you and one additional member of your family, flex time, flexibility to work from home or in the office, yearly ophthalmological health bonus, and the opportunity to improve your English skills by working side-by-side with international teams and projects, apart from fully personalized English classes, and more!All resumes and application answers must be in English

Data AnalystAbout us/team scope:We are the End-to-End Supply Chain team of Walmart USA based in Costa Rica. We design advanced analytical solutions to resolve supply chain strategic problems. We are responsible for the establishment of the data foundation and governance of the supply chain data, providing stewardship, ensuring quality & resolving data issues to offer the single version of truth for the end-to-end supply chain.Entry Requirements ‚Äì Minimum Qualifications:¬∑ Bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer science, engineering, or a data related field.¬∑ 3+ years of experience in data analyst or business intelligence related position.¬∑ High intermediate / Advanced English level (B2+ - C1). Able to communicate in English (written and spoken) with native speakers.¬∑ Proven SQL experience and presenting results to different stakeholders.¬∑ Good interpersonal relationships and presentation skills.¬∑ Demonstrated teamwork and customer centered abilities. Desired skills:¬∑ Database management using tools like Big Query, Presto, Hadoop, MSSQL Server, Oracle.¬∑ Cloud Technologies Knowledge.¬∑ Advance level proficiency in Structured Query Language (SQL).¬∑ Data Visualization tools such as: Tableau, Power BI and/or Looker.¬∑ Availability to travel to Home Office (USA) if required.Job description (Individual Contributor role):We are searching for a Data Analyst responsible of enable advance analytics solutions aligned with data management and business requirements using cloud technologies such as Google Cloud and Azure.We are searching for a Data Analyst responsible for: ¬∑ Translates business logic from multiple data sources like Excel, Oracle, SQL Server to complex SQL queries to calculate KPIs.¬∑ Perform data analysis to solve complex problems and identify value generating trends and insights from multiple data sources.¬∑ Create ad-hoc reports and database queries to support customer data analytics objectives, including identifying key insights, trends, and focal points within the data.Performs initial data quality checks on extracted data and end to end data validation to maintain accuracy of the KPIs.¬∑ Supports the understanding of the priority order of requirements and service level agreements. Helps identify the most suitable source for data that is fit for purpose. ¬∑ Identifies what methods (for example, analytics, big data analytics, automation) would provide a solution for the problem. Shares use cases and gives examples to demonstrate how the method would solve the business problem.¬∑ Engage with customers from different areas to understand their business needs from a data standpoint and translate those into actions plans to fulfill those needs. ¬∑ Communicate effectively and develop relationship with technical experts and business leaders in a dynamic, multicultural, and international environment.

Desired skills:¬∑ Database management using tools like Big Query, Presto, Hadoop, MSSQL Server, Oracle.¬∑ Cloud Technologies Knowledge.¬∑ Advance level proficiency in Structured Query Language (SQL).¬∑ Data Visualization tools such as: Tableau, Power BI and/or Looker.¬∑ Availability to travel to Home Office (USA) if required.Job description (Individual Contributor role):We are searching for a Data Analyst responsible of enable advance analytics solutions aligned with data management and business requirements using cloud technologies such as Google Cloud and Azure.We are searching for a Data Analyst responsible for: ¬∑ Translates business logic from multiple data sources like Excel, Oracle, SQL Server to complex SQL queries to calculate KPIs.¬∑ Perform data analysis to solve complex problems and identify value generating trends and insights from multiple data sources.¬∑ Create ad-hoc reports and database queries to support customer data analytics objectives, including identifying key insights, trends, and focal points within the data.Performs initial data quality checks on extracted data and end to end data validation to maintain accuracy of the KPIs.¬∑ Supports the understanding of the priority order of requirements and service level agreements. Helps identify the most suitable source for data that is fit for purpose. ¬∑ Identifies what methods (for example, analytics, big data analytics, automation) would provide a solution for the problem. Shares use cases and gives examples to demonstrate how the method would solve the business problem.¬∑ Engage with customers from different areas to understand their business needs from a data standpoint and translate those into actions plans to fulfill those needs. ¬∑ Communicate effectively and develop relationship with technical experts and business leaders in a dynamic, multicultural, and international environment.

It is an exciting time at IFF as we continue to grow our Digital Operations team!Create a change that everyone wants a taste of. Make a difference at IFF. If you haven‚Äôt heard of IFF before (treasures are truly hard to find), it‚Äôs time to get excited. Welcome to the world‚Äôs best-kept secret and scent. At IFF, we apply science and creativity for a better world, push past traditional boundaries and towards a more sustainable future. We are on a mission to co-create sensorial experiences that delight and go beyond the expectations of consumers everywhere.While have grown over the years, we remain agile in our approach and put our customers‚Äô needs at the forefront of our thinking. We are an international collective of thinkers represented at over 110 manufacturing sites and 100 R&D centers globally. Now is your chance to join us and help us to find digital solutions to make our work even better, more influential, and more sustainable.To achieve this ambitious goal, we need you. How You‚Äôll Leave Your Mark as a Data Engineer, you will be responsible for expanding and optimizing our data and data pipeline architecture, as well as optimizing data flow and collection for cross-functional teams.You will support our software developers, database architects, data analysts, and data scientists on data initiatives and will ensure optimal data delivery architecture is consistent throughout ongoing projects.You will‚Ä¶Identify data solutions that have business applications and translate them into design specifications and codeWrite ETL processes, design database systems, and develop tools for real-time and offline analytic processingTroubleshoot software and processes for data consistency and integrity. Integrate large scale data from a variety of sources for business partners to generate insight and make decisionsDesign and conduct training sessions on tools, data sources, and architecture. Provide job aids and mentoring to team members and business usersKeep up to speed with the latest industry and technology developments, and apply them to solve analytics challenges focused on business performanceYou have‚Ä¶A degree in Computer Science or relatedAt least 5 years of software development or data engineering experienceProficiency with languages/tools Python, SQL, GitExperience with On Premise and Cloud based infrastructuresStrongly preferred:DevOps or MLOps experienceDocker, KubernetesExperience deploying ML and non-ML data products with AWSWhy working at IFF will be the cherry on the cake of your career. We cherish your individuality. Our diversity, equity, and inclusion programs prove that different backgrounds and attitudes are key factors to our success. We know your worth. We guarantee an attractive and competitive salary as a means of showing you our appreciation. We value your personal work style. We trust you. Whether you work remotely or on site, we want you to do what‚Äôs best for you and shape your work to fit your life. We trust your creativity. We support out-of-the-box thinking without hierarchies. In our teams, it‚Äôs the best idea that wins, not the one from the highest position. We want you to thrive. Our IFF university will meet all your personal development and growth needs because now is only the beginning. We care about you. Our health insurance and pension plans ensure that your well-being is secure ‚Äì professionally and privately.

Data Engineer Level 2-4Entravision is a leading global advertising, media, and ad-tech solutions company connecting brands to consumers by representing top platforms and publishers. Our global commercial footprint is anchored by strategic regional operations in the US, Latin America, Europe, and Asia. This means 5 continents and 30+ countries, and on path to becoming a multinational tech and marketing powerhouse.These branches forge strong client relationships, robust sales operations, and a common globalized corporate culture. Headquartered in Santa Monica, California, USA. shares of Entravision Class A Common Stock trade on The New York Stock Exchange under the ticker symbol: EVC.We are seeking a Data Engineer to join our Global BA and Platforms team. to design, build, manage, and improve our data infrastructure to support robust analytical operations. S/he will assist in the expansion and maintenance of a data warehouse by the construction of views and tables, replace Alteryx workflows with SQL views to help automate manual reporting, support the BI Team with SQL expertise, and architect and implement solutions to meet Entravision's growing internal demand for accurate, accessible data. We are looking for an experienced SQL query-builder who is interested in honing their craft and expanding their role in an exciting, influential, and growing department. While we only have one opening, we will accept candidates for level 2, 3, or 4. The final candidate will work from Montevideo office reporting to the Manager of Enterprise Data Solution based in our US corporate office.Responsibilities IncludeDevelop database tables, views, and stored procedures.Create, monitor, and maintain ETL processes.Document the database and ETL systems including any changes or improvements to the database are implemented.Ensure data quality and integrity in databases.Monitor and report on costs for Database and ETL services.In collaboration with BI Manager, provide guidance, solution design, detailed requirements, and governance for data needs such as acquisition, query, update, transfer, store, archive, etc.Assist with schema design, code review, and SQL query tuning.Work with analysts to secure easy access to company data.Help prioritize, ensure execution, and communicate timelines for existing BI roadmap, new BI requests, and BI platform or underlying data issues.Proactively and regularly make recommendations for system improvementsStay up to date on best practices in Business Intelligence and Data Warehousing.Participate in special projects and perform other duties and assignments as needed. Soft SkillsA proactive team-player with the ability to multitask, think creatively, and learn quickly in a fast-paced, results-driven environment.A resourceful, motivated self-starter with the ability to complete work independently and on time.Strong verbal and written communications skills in English.The willingness to both offer, and receive, constructive feedback.Technical RequirementsLevel I:1 - 2 years of SQL Scripting experienceExperience in OLAP databases such as Snowflake or RedshiftExperience with a BI tool (Tableau, PowerBI, Microstrategy)Experience with an ETL tool (Fivetran, Stitch, Rivery, Airbyte)Cloud Storage (S3, Blob)Batch and Cron JobsLevel II (level I Plus)3+ years of SQL Scripting experienceExperience making API calls in Python, Curl, PostmanWrite testable production code in scripting language (Python, Scala, Java)Experience using JIRA Software and ConfluenceData serialization formats (CSV, JSON, XML, Parquet, Avro, YAML)Level III (level II Plus)Experience in making API calls in Python, Curl, PostmanExposure to transformation tool like DBTWrite testable production code in scripting language (Python, Scala, Java)Orchestrate cloud infrastructure using IaC tools (Terraform, AWS CloudFormation, Azure Resource Manager)Data serialization formats (CSV, JSON, XML, Parquet, Avro, YAML)Level IV (level III Plus)Experience with DevOps: CI/CD, deployment, orchestration, and control systems such as GitUnderstanding of NoSQL databasesData architecture and modeling (Kimball, Inmon, Data Vault)Experience with orchestrator tools such as Airflow or LuigiFamiliar with data governance strategies and tools Experience with PySparkKnowledge of data Streaming best practices and tools (Kafka, Kinesis) Other DutiesPlease note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.Entravision Communications Corporation participates in the E-Verify system operated by the US Department of Homeland Security and the Social Security Administration and will use E-Verify to confirm work eligibility for all new hire employees.Entravision Communications is an Equal Opportunity Employer.We encourage women and minorities to apply.

DescriptionAt Neostella, we take a customer-centric approach and use cutting-edge technologies to deliver solutions to meet the unique needs of our clients‚Äô business. We show them how hyperautomation can free up time to focus on higher impact work and take their business to the next level. In order to continue our growth, we are seeking a Data Engineer! By joining our team, you‚Äôll work in a fast-paced, rapidly growing, startup environment. We are looking for a Data Engineer experienced SQL and Python Engineer with expertise in data warehouse and data migrations. This The ideal candidate will have experience with various ETL (extract, transform, load) tools and has experience in developing ETL processes to ensure data quality, accuracy, and consistency. They also have experience in working with large data sets, as well as optimizing SQL queries and improving database performance.Key Responsibilities:Develop and maintain complex SQL scripts and queries to extract, transform, and load data into a data warehouse. Design, implement and optimize data models and database schema for efficient data storage and retrieval. Perform data migrations and integrations between different data sources and systems using Python programming language. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into technical specifications. Analyze, troubleshoot and resolve issues related to data quality, integrity and performance. Develop and maintain documentation of data architecture, data flows, and data lineage. Ensure compliance with data governance policies, standards, and best practices. Develop and maintain data models to support the organization's data needs. Requirements1+ years of experience in SQL development and data modeling for data warehousing. Strong proficiency in Python programming. Experience with ETL tools. Knowledge of cloud-based data storage solutions such as AWS S3, Azure Blob Storage, or Google Cloud Storage. Familiarity with Agile software development methodologies. Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work independently as well as in a team environment. Strong communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders. Desire experience with Ruby or Workato. Fluency in written and spoken English is required. BenefitsYou will have Undefined Contract, a fast and deep growing career path, pre-paid health insurance coverage with Sura for you and one additional member of your family, flex time, flexibility to work from home or in the office, yearly ophthalmological health bonus, and the opportunity to improve your English skills by working side-by-side with international teams and projects, apart from fully personalized English classes, and more!All resumes and application answers must be in English

Data AnalystAbout us/team scope:We are the End-to-End Supply Chain team of Walmart USA based in Costa Rica. We design advanced analytical solutions to resolve supply chain strategic problems. We are responsible for the establishment of the data foundation and governance of the supply chain data, providing stewardship, ensuring quality & resolving data issues to offer the single version of truth for the end-to-end supply chain.Entry Requirements ‚Äì Minimum Qualifications:¬∑ Bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer science, engineering, or a data related field.¬∑ 3+ years of experience in data analyst or business intelligence related position.¬∑ High intermediate / Advanced English level (B2+ - C1). Able to communicate in English (written and spoken) with native speakers.¬∑ Proven SQL experience and presenting results to different stakeholders.¬∑ Good interpersonal relationships and presentation skills.¬∑ Demonstrated teamwork and customer centered abilities. Desired skills:¬∑ Database management using tools like Big Query, Presto, Hadoop, MSSQL Server, Oracle.¬∑ Cloud Technologies Knowledge.¬∑ Advance level proficiency in Structured Query Language (SQL).¬∑ Data Visualization tools such as: Tableau, Power BI and/or Looker.¬∑ Availability to travel to Home Office (USA) if required.Job description (Individual Contributor role):We are searching for a Data Analyst responsible of enable advance analytics solutions aligned with data management and business requirements using cloud technologies such as Google Cloud and Azure.We are searching for a Data Analyst responsible for: ¬∑ Translates business logic from multiple data sources like Excel, Oracle, SQL Server to complex SQL queries to calculate KPIs.¬∑ Perform data analysis to solve complex problems and identify value generating trends and insights from multiple data sources.¬∑ Create ad-hoc reports and database queries to support customer data analytics objectives, including identifying key insights, trends, and focal points within the data.Performs initial data quality checks on extracted data and end to end data validation to maintain accuracy of the KPIs.¬∑ Supports the understanding of the priority order of requirements and service level agreements. Helps identify the most suitable source for data that is fit for purpose. ¬∑ Identifies what methods (for example, analytics, big data analytics, automation) would provide a solution for the problem. Shares use cases and gives examples to demonstrate how the method would solve the business problem.¬∑ Engage with customers from different areas to understand their business needs from a data standpoint and translate those into actions plans to fulfill those needs. ¬∑ Communicate effectively and develop relationship with technical experts and business leaders in a dynamic, multicultural, and international environment.
